content:
Posted: October 7, 2015
												I received a low-threat prisoner, so I didn't pay much attention to him. How wrong I was..It was a normal, average day. The prisoners were eating their lunch.. then it happened.He attacked from the shadows.Prisoner "Leeroy jenkins" viciously started stabbing my guards with his plastic fork. It was 5 against one.He'll never win, I thought.He'll never escape, I thought.He'll never survive, I thought.I thought wrong.He managed to start a full-scale riot, him and his army of offenders. They broke all 7 of my steel doors with their bare fists, escaping into the yard. They were almost out. I quickly hired God-knows-how-many dog handlers, in a valiant effort to hold them back until the authorities get here. I managed to keep the tsunami of prisoners back, put the prison on lockdown and finally the armed police got here.I did it, I stopped the riot.But then I saw that one particular cell was empty. Then I realized..LEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEROOOOOOOOOOOY JEEEENKINS!54/11 would plastic fork again.

content:
Posted: May 29, 2014
												This game is absolutely terrible, until you get used to it. The goodness of the game scales with the skill of the player. Luckily this game is easy to get used to. This game is definitely worth spending your precious time on. The game modes consist of general martial arts such as Judo and Aikido, however, for the more... shall I say, mature gamers out there, there are game modes that are more like "marital" arts such as "torisex" (uncommonly found on servers). This game allows players to control just about every joint in their tori's body, creating over-the-top moves and combos. Limbs can fracture and dismember, adding to the satisfaction of your already oh so sweet victory. There is a microtransaction system however the effects are purely cosmetic and can also be earned by completing matches. This game is one of my favourites and I definitely recommend it to everyone who is willing to spend at least some time getting used to it.

content:
Posted: January 2, 2015
												Toribash is a free-to-play game where you control the individual tori limbs each of them can have 4 different states meaning number of possible moves is almost endless. It is fun to play with friends and with strangers and making a server is as easy as counting to 3. However, there are some downsides to such a game, even with almost 24 hours of constant playing I still find it hard to perform the most basic of moves and some may not have the patience to spend a long time experimenting. Also, the community is pretty♥♥♥♥♥♥♥and will comment on every move you do, trying to correct you which may sound helpful but in reality is incredibly annoying.There is also a wide range of mods that can be easily accessed by pressing ctrl  + m as the host of a game, ranging from a sword fight to 'torisex', these can really make the game much more fun.

content:
Posted: June 27, 2016
												Toribash is a great game for multiple reasons. There is a few flaws about the game because it's not perfect. Some great things about it is the freedom you have over the character's body. Because of this, many combinations of body parts can be  used to create awesome moves. Multiplayer is VERY simple and requires no difficulty in creating a server. There are a LOT of mods that come with this game that requires no downloads. A few cons is that it can get repetitive if playing for long periods of time. Also, a lot of in game-currency is required to unlock new character skins and that's about it. I strongly recommend this game and the best part about it is that it's free!

												Awesome game, I've been playin it for 8 hrs (100+ hrs now!) and still loving it! This game has really good physics, you can make new fighting moves/control your own body and best of all, THE RANKS, and the RAGDOLL. But I dont recommend (Kinda) it for people who has no patience, or hates fighting games and hates being in queue now you dont have to be in a queue they added a matchmaking system for people who wants to play with unranks or ranked 1v1 so you dont have to wait in a queue. Or verse a person the same belt as you which is GREAT. It is really satisfying just winning one round, and it will make you wanna play more, trust me it's addicting. Personally I think 50 hours + is worth.8.5/10

content:
Posted: May 20, 2014
												FINALLY its on Steam. This game is strategic, sometimes fast paced, and it requires quick thinking. When you start playing you see all these cool replays and you think "how can I do that?". Well in the beginning, you can't. But don't be discouraged keep playing and practice. Soon you will understand the game and then you can make your tori do anything that pops into your head. This game takes practice and creativity. Being creative is what its all about. Whether you are making replays or fighting another player you need to be creative. Make your very own moves so you can have others saying "WOW!". There is not much that I want changed with the game except for maybe a better tutorial for new players and maybe a matchmaking system. I reccomend this game for anyone looking for a free game. Alsothis game has a steep learning curve, but stick around and you won't want to leave. If you quit before you've learned the game, thats fine but you have missed out.

content:
Posted: June 27, 2016
												Toribash is a great game for multiple reasons. There is a few flaws about the game because it's not perfect. Some great things about it is the freedom you have over the character's body. Because of this, many combinations of body parts can be  used to create awesome moves. Multiplayer is VERY simple and requires no difficulty in creating a server. There are a LOT of mods that come with this game that requires no downloads. A few cons is that it can get repetitive if playing for long periods of time. Also, a lot of in game-currency is required to unlock new character skins and that's about it. I strongly recommend this game and the best part about it is that it's free!

content:
Posted: May 27, 2016
												Very simple at the beginning but as the understanding of the game grows so does the experience. Not so fun to play alone, but loads of fun with friends for a long time. You can play it casually, or learn some advanced techniques and spend 100s of hours in tournaments. Along with public servers you can get your own skins, modify the gravity, use custom maps, and change just about any feature of the game, and ITS FREE!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8, 2015
												Well... If you put even a decent amount of time into the game it feels very rewarding. Maybe take a day or two to get used to the movement of joints. Also let me tell you that the tutorial sucks, if you need help go to there forums on the beginners thread and ask for help in the mod you play. If you don't know what mod you are playing ask someone in the lobby you are in or if you are alone, or with just a friend the default mod is Aikido most of the time. Anyways on with the review.Honestly one of the best games I have put time into. I am am blue belt and have beaten black belts, I honestly think is was because of the time I put into it as soon as I picked it up. If you plan to play this you need to put time into it to be good, don't expect to get in and be good (Of course there are some exceptions). Anyways I give this game a 10/10 for its "different" gameplay aspect, its mostly friendly community, and its great mods to play for fun or to compete in.

content:
Posted: January 7, 2015
												An interesting take on fighting games, and a good one at that. The fighting isn't about mashing keys or memorising combos, but rather chosing how and which joints to use. This obviously leads to many failures and fights won by flopping around until someone is disqualified for beginners, yet in higher levels, people can pull of stunning moves. The extremeness  of high level players gets to the point where they can use their enemies head as a weapon, and luckily a feature of the game is to save and watch replays (there are some included).

												I've played this game since 2009 when it wasn't on steam yet. I've amassed AT LEAST 5000 hours on this game, its truly video game heroin. The game is very hard to get good at, but once you get good its extremely fun. I always find myself coming back to toribash.Pros: Has great staff.the rules are fairly liberal with a "Just don't be stupid" approach.Very fun with a variety of mods/gamestyles you can play around with.Overall very competitive.Cons:Toxic players.Dueling is dead.Would definately recommed commiting to (And yes, this game is a commitment if you want to get anywhere on it, but once you do its amazing)

content:
Posted: March 7, 2015
												I played this for a little bit, it's not something I can get the hang of xDI'm actually afraid to even wonder what playing with some of the more elite players would be like. Simply put this is a pretty cool game, the concept is nice, using body mechanis, just simply turning, raising lowering, extending, retracting, relaxing parts of your characters body and gripping the others to in turn beat the ever loved "S**T" out of your enemy looks pretty fun but I cannot get the hang of it xDIt may be easier in the actual pvp because you have to compensate for your enemies movements to create more complex combos but with how badly I was doing I think I'll just have to miss out on it. But from simply looking at the video if this looks like a game for you, give it a try. Play the tutorial and learn what the game is about and I promise you you'll love it.

content:
Posted: February 12, 2016
												This game is amazing, full control of your character, make it do what you want, customise it and add your on looks, upload your skins, textures, have music when you enter a battle tourneys, all the mods you could imagine free.The game is easy to run and any computer can play it, the graphics are smooth and the physics work like a charmThe list goes on on what you could do, parkour, tournaments, fights, host a server to play with your friends, belts to distinguish pro's from beginners.now i have to add that you won't be making the moves you see in the trailer at the start, took me a year to learn to walk in the game:Dbut none the less, don't get frustrated when you can't win, just try and try over again and soon enough you will be as good as the top players.this game is amazing and i could talk about it forever, but i don't have forever and theres your overview about the game.
